page.title: 03Badlesmere : Attitudes
page.content: Following is a consensus from the local Womens Institute Group. Smoking is regarded as anti-social. Litter is a problem; fly dumping of household rubbish is rife even though official tips are available. Moral standards have lowered. Readily available drugs (heroin, cannabis, marijuana) and solvent abuse are a grave concern with the young. Television and videos are appreciated but concern is felt over excess of violence shown. Women appreciate the benefits of kitchen electrical appliances (washing machines, tumble driers, microwave ovens). There is concern over the threat of Nuclear Weapons and youth unemployment which is considered a major cause of behavioural problems. There is currently strong opposition to the proposed fixed channel link.
